Reviews.Content: We were really pleased! Given the price of the Hotel Colorado that we managed to get on venere.com, we weren't expecting 4 star accommodation- in fact, we were expecting 1 star... The hotel was easy to find, and close to the centre of florence, as advertised. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but they let us get changed and washed and leave our bags witht hem until we wnated to check in, which was fine for us. The room was large, generally clean, with everything you needed and we felt that their service was warm and efficient. a lovely breakfast and an easy check out and again they let us leave our bags until we were leaving florence. Expect what you're paying for and you'll be really pleased, as we were. We'd visit again!
Reviews.Author: MikeDarlo

Reviews.Content: The Good, the Bad and the sometimes Ugly!!! The Good..It is a good location for accesssing al amenities, especially the Statue of David. Also, check-in staff were very helpful.The Bad..Breakfast was very poor, stale coffee and bread rolls were the order of the day! The hotel is also situated several floors up with no lift or porter facilities.The Ugly...we discovered a nice surprise of a used condom packet in the desk drawer, which doesnt exactly demonstrate their eye for detail.
Reviews.Author: NoCapische

Reviews.Content: Avoid I read great reviews of this place and was completely mislead. The place is definitely not worth your money. It has a good location, but thats about it. In fact we found the place pretty scary and couldnt even stay there. The staff was friendly and helpful, but I would recommend going for a 3 star hotel and spending the extra $20 bucks. At least you will not feel as ripped off as we did when we were given the key to our room. I was extremely disappointed and it definitely was not what I expected after reading the reviews. I was charged $100 plus tax which came to about $125/night. You can find MUCH better places for about $150. Definitely worth it to spend the extra 25 dollars!
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravel12345

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel This is the best 1-star hotel I've seen.The location is very convenient, it's close to all the landmarks.The room was neat and cozy.The service was great, we got various information and recommendation of a good restaurant.The breakfast was very nice.For conclusion - great value and highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: silenzio

Reviews.Content: very good hotel with friendly staff a very nice hotel with friendly staff. i had a satisfying 3-night stay in this hotel in florence. one thing to mention: i lost my digital photo storage box in this hotel, and their staff found it back and mailed it to me. i feel very grateful for this help.
Reviews.Author: xmw

Reviews.Content: great hotel with good value I enjoyed by stay at the hotel Colorado very much. The hotel is small and the rooms are not without their flaws, but for the price I paid, I am 110% happy. The owner was very friendly, I felt safe in my room, and the bed was comfortable. The downsides - you have to walk the stairs to the hotel (not really a problem unless you have many bags). Also, in a style similar to several hostels I have stayed in, the bathroom was small (the sink was in the shower). All this being said, if you are looking for an inexpensive place to stay in florence, I highly recommend the hotel colorado.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice budget hotel find. We stayed at Hotel Colorado in October 2005 with our 2 little children. If you have a lot of luggage, take a taxi from the Florence SMN train station. Otherwise, it's about a 20 minute walk from there. Many steps to the 2nd floor(more like 3rd floor), where the hotel is located, no elevator. The staff is friendly and they speak English. Continental Breakfast included with room. Our triple room was large and clean with a small balcony opening to the indoor courtyard. No television. No hairdryer. Our bathroom was large and clean. Reception desk is closed at night and you have a key issued to gain entrance to the hotel which is on one floor of the building it is in. Close to the sites and minutes from the Accademia. Franco, who answered our e-mail from the hotel booked reservations for us at the Accademia and Uffizi. We would stay here again. Pack light.
Reviews.Author: Suburbanite05

Reviews.Content: Excellent value At 35 Euros a night you can't go wrong. The entrance however, is a bit scary. It means taking two flights of stairs in a dark, dingy stairwell. I was wandering what I had gotten myself into. When I opened the door to the hotel, however, all seemed right. There is only staff during the daytime but, guests are given keys to their room and the dingy stairway to let themselves in and out at any time. The staff is English speaking, friendly and helpful. The room and the bathroom are fully equiped (except for no tv) and very clean. The location is walking distance from most of the tourist sights and is also walking distance to the train station. Because the rooms are small and there is no real lobby, this is probably not a good place for children.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Simple Hotel for a Nice Price
Reviews.Author: washingtondcgirl

Reviews.Content: a nice little hotel We stayed at the Hotel Colorado late Oct.2005 and enjoyed our stay. Our room fit our family of 4 with 1 dbl. bed and 2 singles. The rm was large with a good size bathroom and patio doors that led to balcony. My teenage son enjoyed eating pizza out there to get away from his sister. I don't know if air condition was available as it was cool during our stay. A new coat of paint would improve the rooms appearance, and there is some dirt/dust on white patio doors from construction across the way, and no screens...but no problem with mosquitos this time of year. The window in our restroom did have a screen and the restroom really was fine but shower was reminiscent of some of my trips to nontourist areas in Mexico. My children really enjoyed the buffet breakfast, which was included in rate. The staff was helpful at all times,spoke english well,and arranged our tickets by e-mail to the Accademia (a 5 min walk)and also helped us call and speak to the keepers(they spoke no english) of the Agrituismo we were to stay in near Siena. One of the negatives, is that the actual hotel is on the 3rd floor and it is a climb after walking from the bus stop(San Marco piazza) with luggage. Overall, I would say that Hotel Colorado has great rates for families and they really made us feel as though they were happy to serve us. It is a little antiquated but that was what we were looking for to add to the history of Florence.
Reviews.Author: TexasLove2trvl

Reviews.Content: the long climb We were very skeptical the first night of our stay where we ended up in a non airconditioned boiler room. Things were set in order the next morning when we got an AC room which we had paid for. Entire staff extremely friendly and booked tickets to teh accademia and the uffizi before we even got there. Hotel is located on the 3rd floor with no elevator... not for the frail. The rooms (except the non air conditioned) are modest but comfortable (definitely no frills). The hotel is located about 3 blocks from the duomo ...(be prepared to walk in Florence .. thats almost the only means of transportation in the central area). This place is almost like a big house with free access to the refrigerator and dining area at night. Although we had our doubts initially, it proved to be a good choice.
Reviews.Author: desieurojunkie

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel offering value for money       Room with a view
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Tough steps but worth it. Convenient location; good value; more than adequate breakfast. It's just the 62 steps to the third floor that are troublesome. The weather this past week is Florence was not helpful (37-40 C each day) but this little hotel had very efficient air-conditioning that made the nights bearable. Helpful, kind staff. Not a luxury joint but clean and well managed. The beds were very firm but also very comfortable. Quiet, not a party place but there were lots of young people there. Internet access for 1 E. All in all, a good deal.
Reviews.Author: Lukehead

Reviews.Content: Great Little Place Great little hotel! Very friendly and helpful staff. Location is nice too -- easy 5 minute walk or so to the heart of Florence, but far enough away so you can sleep without all the noise. Manager and/or owner speaks excellent English. Nice continental breakfast. Would stay here again without a doubt.
Reviews.Author: WillCulp

Reviews.Content: Excellent value Perfect location near all the attractions. Rooms are small but cozy; pretty good breakfast is provided. My only complaint is the lack of the elevator as the hotel is located on the third floor.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lovely, small, friendly hotel Small but perfectly formed! My room was very small, as was the whole hotel, and this only added to the charm. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and everything was spotless. Breakfast was very nice indeed - everything you could have thought of was laid out on the buffet table. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again. The only disadvantage is that the hotel occupies the third floor and there is no lift, so wheelchair users or those who find stairs a problem would find access impossible.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Colorado in Florence I found the hotel Colorado very nice and clean, just in the center of Florence. It's very cheap and near the monuments. I was there with my family two weeks ago.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
